greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of n and its arithmetic derivative.
comment: a(n) = 1 iff n is squarefree (A005117), cf. A068328.
This sequence is very probably multiplicative. - _Mitch Harris_, Apr 19 2005
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Victor Ufnarovski and Bo Ahlander, How to Differentiate a Number, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 6, 2003, #03.3.4.
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if p divides e; a(p^e) = p^(e-1) otherwise. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Oct 22 2013
Thus a(A276086(n)) = A328572(n), by the above formula and the fact that A276086 is a permutation of A048103.
maple: else pfs:=ifactors(n)[2]; a:=n*add(op(2, p)/op(1, p), p=pfs);
mathematica: d[0] = d[1] = 0; d[n_] := d[n] = n*Total[Apply[#2/#1 &, FactorInteger[n], {1}]]; a[n_] := GCD[n, d[n]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 96}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 21 2014 *)
program: a085731 n = gcd n $ a003415 n -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 10 2011
(PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, if (f[i,2] % f[i,1], f[i,2]--);); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 14 2016
xref: Cf. A072873 (positions of records), A268398 (partial sums).
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 20 2003
